pullrequest.title: patch for issue #1167, where pr2 screw joint is misbehaving (it's simply drifting).

content.raw:
There's a weird race condition that causes the `ScrewJointLimitForce/0` (ode) to seg-fault (see [Jenkins test failure](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-precise-amd64-gpu-nvidia/8/testReport/junit/%28root%29/INTEGRATION_joint_screw/test_ran/)) when all tests are run sequentially, though it doesn't happen if they are run individually (ie. `test/integration/INTEGRATION_joint_screw --gtest_filter="*ScrewJointLimitForce/0"` doesn't seg-fault).

The back trace is related to rendering. I will look at this briefly with @iche033 ; if it's not an easy fix, I would propose moving the new test to a separate pull request so we can merge the fix sooner.

I know, @hsu, I'm the one who asked for the new test, but I wasn't anticipating a rendering race condition.

UPDATE: filed as #1172
